author: pawel-domanski
body:
Hi

I have Linux and Windows operating system. When I use on Windows 
$HTML = Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $u
A was 
IsPublic IsSerial Name                                     BaseType             -------- -------- ----                                     --------             
True     False    HtmlWebResponseObject               Microsoft.PowerSh...
when it run on linux i was
IsPublic IsSerial Name                                     BaseType             -------- -------- ----                                     --------             
True     False    BasicHtmlWebResponseObject               Microsoft.PowerSh...

and some functions like ParseHtml doesn't work.

Where is problem? 

Regards Paweł

comments.author: markekraus
pawel-domanski
comments.body:
Yes, on 5.1 on windows.
Sorry on linux I can see ParseHtml or I don't know how use it.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell Core 6 uses different web client classes (due to limitations of corefx) so the output type is different and this is expected.  `ParsedHtml` is not currently supported as that depended on InternetExplorer to do the parsing.  That is being tracked here https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/2867

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @pdomansk ok. I just wanted to make sure. That is by design. PowerShell Core on Windows will behave the same way as it does on Linux.  This is not the same as it was in Windows PowerShell 5.1.

title: BasicHtmlWebResponseObject and HtmlWebResponseObject
